page.title: 07THE SHIRE HALL
page.content: Shire Hall is the headquarters for the County Council of Berkshire. It is the administrative centre of Berkshire and the 700,000 people who live there. It runs Berkshire County Council and the six Borough or District Councils. Each District elects a representative who meets in the Council Chambers and decides on Council policies.The Council is responsible for education, fire service, libraries, housing, etc. The present Shire Hall is situated in Shinfield Park.They started building the hall in 1974 and it was finished in 1979. Prior to this it was split between severel sites in the centre of Reading. It is made of six linked, 2 and 3 storeyed octagonal pavilions of gravel faced concrete and tinted glass.Shire Hall holds a charter from the Queen giving Berkshire permission to call itself the "Royal County".
